subject: Self Care
title: Flow Triggers
description: A quick win: understand Flow Triggers.

hook.text: You can't force flow, but you can create the conditions. Steven Kotler identified 17 triggers that make flow more likely.

buildup.text: Key triggers include clear goals, immediate feedback, deep concentration, and a distraction-free environment.

discovery.text: Novelty, complexity, and unpredictability also trigger flow. The brain engages deeply when it encounters something genuinely new.

twist.text: Social flow exists too. Group activities with shared risk and close communication can trigger collective flow beyond solo flow.

climax.text: Before deep work, set a clear goal, eliminate distractions, and ensure the task stretches your skill. Invite flow in.

punchline.text: You can't force flow, but you can set the conditions. Prepare the stage.

quiz.question: Which conditions help trigger a flow state?
options: Clear goals, immediate feedback, and a distraction-free environment
Extremely easy tasks with no pressure
